title: Birds in Landscape
marks:
Inscriptions and Signature

Right: {Saishiki kac Left: [Saishiki kacho shugetsu hitsu/hogan yasunob
text:
On the right screen, a horned owl in a pine tree watches hawks chase herons at the edge of a lotus pond. On the left screen, cranes, ducks, and other birds are dispersed among plum, bamboo, reed, and hibiscus. An inscription by the painter Kanō Yasunobu (1613–1685) assigns this pair to Shūgetsu Tōkan; on the other side is a painting of pine trees on gold leaf by Yasunobu.
(2013.29.20.1-.2)
description: pallette is predominanty beige, grey, white and green; two white cranes on panel 2 with several other birds and ducks; bamboo on L; painting on back of screen also
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
